translation.title: Dwelling at the Root of a Tree

segments.en: 183. Dwelling at the Root of a Tree
“Mendicants, there are these five kinds of people who dwell at the root of a tree.

segments.pli: Mandattā momūhattā rukkhamūliko hoti … pe … idamatthitaṃyeva nissāya rukkhamūliko hoti.
segments.en: A person may dwell at the root of a tree because of stupidity … bad desires … madness … because it is praised by the Buddhas … or for the sake of having few wishes …
These are the five kinds of people who dwell at the root of a tree.”
